channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Protecting Unique Wilderness at the Bottom of the World
item.description: Chile is poised to create it's 47th national part in the coming year, protecting wilderness at the southern tip of South America. That's thanks in large part to the work of a U.S. conservationist and her organization. We go to the bottom of the world to see the stunning landscape that will make up the park.
item.content:encoded: Chile is poised to create it's 47th national part in the coming year, protecting wilderness at the southern tip of South America. That's thanks in large part to the work of a U.S. conservationist and her organization. We go to the bottom of the world to see the stunning landscape that will make up the park.
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett

item.title: Some rural Nevadans want Trump to stop the state's solar energy boom
item.description: Backlash against massive solar energy farms drove strong rural turnout in Nevada may have helped flip the presidential vote there to Republican for the first time since 2004. But it's not a given Trump will derail President Biden's plans for more Nevada solar.
item.content:encoded:
Backlash against massive solar energy farms drove strong rural turnout in Nevada may have helped flip the presidential vote there to Republican for the first time since 2004. But it's not a given Trump will derail President Biden's plans for more Nevada solar.

(Image credit: Ethan Miller/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: France's toppled government adds to the European Union's bigger political problems
item.description: The political instability in France — and simultaneously in Germany, where the governing coalition collapsed a month ago — could have wide-ranging consequences.
item.content:encoded:
The political instability in France — and simultaneously in Germany, where the governing coalition collapsed a month ago — could have wide-ranging consequences.

(Image credit: Telmo Pinto)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: NASA delays Artemis II human moon mission once again as it wraps up heat shield investigation
item.description: The mission to take four astronauts on a trip around the moon and back, previously targeting a launch at the end of 2025, has been delayed until at least April, 2026.
item.content:encoded:
The mission to take four astronauts on a trip around the moon and back, previously targeting a launch at the end of 2025, has been delayed until at least April, 2026.

(Image credit: Joel Kowsky)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: How worried should we be about Disease X?
item.description: An unidentified illness has claimed nearly 80 lives in DRC. Investigators are on the scenes to determine what it is — and how much of a threat it poses locally and globally.
item.content:encoded:
An unidentified illness has claimed nearly 80 lives in DRC. Investigators are on the scenes to determine what it is — and how much of a threat it poses locally and globally.

(Image credit: PeterHermesFurian/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Pope Francis goes electric in new eco-friendly popemobile
item.description: Pope Francis, who heads the Catholic Church, has doubled down on his commitment to the environment with a new electric popemobile presented by Mercedes-Benz.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis, who heads the Catholic Church, has doubled down on his commitment to the environment with a new electric popemobile presented by Mercedes-Benz.

(Image credit: Filippo Monteforte/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: A powerful 7.0 earthquake strikes off Northern California coast
item.description: A powerful earthquake struck off the Northern California coast, triggering tsunami warnings that were later canceled. Several aftershocks continued to rattle the area off Eureka.
item.content:encoded:
A powerful earthquake struck off the Northern California coast, triggering tsunami warnings that were later canceled. Several aftershocks continued to rattle the area off Eureka. 

(Image credit: Haven Daley)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Court rejects Boeing plea deal stemming from 737 Max crashes
item.description: A federal judge in Texas has rejected a plea deal between Boeing and the U.S. Justice Department, saying the court should play a bigger role in selecting an independent monitor to oversee the company.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in Texas has rejected a plea deal between Boeing and the U.S. Justice Department, saying the court should play a bigger role in selecting an independent monitor to oversee the company.

(Image credit: David Ryder)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Memphis police use excessive force and discriminate against Black people, the DOJ finds
item.description: A Justice Department investigation launched after the beating death of Tyre Nichols in 2023 found that "Memphis police officers regularly violate the rights of the people they are sworn to serve."
item.content:encoded:
A Justice Department investigation launched after the beating death of Tyre Nichols in 2023 found that "Memphis police officers regularly violate the rights of the people they are sworn to serve."

(Image credit: Gerald Herbert)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: New images are released for a 'person of interest' in the CEO's killing in New York
item.description: Shell casings with the cryptic words "deny," "defend" and "depose" were found at the scene of the fatal shooting of the UnitedHealthcare CEO outside of a Manhattan hotel, police officials say.
item.content:encoded:
Shell casings with the cryptic words "deny," "defend" and "depose" were found at the scene of the fatal shooting of the UnitedHealthcare CEO outside of a Manhattan hotel, police officials say.

(Image credit: New York Police Department)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster
